document_title: Acute arthritis: Causes, signs, treatment, prevention
subsection_content:
Treatment for acute arthritis will depend on the cause and severity of the disease, specifically as follows:
Reactive arthritis, due to inflammation in neighboring organs, causing an inflammatory reaction in the joints: in that case, the root cause needs to be treated, for example, people with gonorrhea infections in the joints need antibiotics.; Non-inflammatory pain: In this case, acetaminophen is often prescribed, joint immobilization with splints, hot and cold compresses are used to relieve pain.; Once the acute pain subsides, physical therapy may be prescribed to improve range of motion and strengthen surrounding muscles. In cases that have progressed to chronicity, the key treatment is ongoing physical activity to prevent muscle loss and permanent joint stiffness.
